meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah always outshouts her teammates.
meanings.sent2: The enthusiastic fan outshouts everyone in the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The little bird outshouts the big rooster in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outshouts the noise of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outshouts the sound of the raindrops.

meanings.sent1: In the shouting contest, Tom outshouts all his competitors.
meanings.sent2: The opera singer outshouts the orchestra with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent3: The cat outshouts the dog when they argue over food.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outshouts his fear during the roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outshouts the students to get their attention.

meanings.sent1: The politician outshouts his opponents in the debate.
meanings.sent2: She outshouts her siblings to be heard in the noisy household.
meanings.sent3: The baby outshouts the adults with his loud cries.
meanings.sent4: The thunder outshouts the whispers of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock outshouts the chirping birds in the morning.
